result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M. Knapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
*No electronic monitor until defendant serves 60 days

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Continue with treatment plan
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regard to alcohol and drugs
*Fill all controlled substances from a single pharmacy.  May obtain specific substance from specific pharmacy, if need by
*Sign all health releases so agent can monitor treatment and medications
*Comply with other counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M. Knapp

records.addlTxt: Copy of Court Ordered Financial Obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason M. Knapp in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:32 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Court has received correspondence from Mr. and Mrs. Suchon as well as from Mr. Knapp's spouse. Correspondence was provided by Atty Barkley and the State received a copy.  Matter is set for a change in plea today.

Parties are ready to proceed.

State has submitted an amended information.

Defendant will plead to 3 counts in amended information.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Constable states the plea agreement.
Atty Barkley concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Atty Barkley received a copy of the amended information.

Defendant wavies reading of the amended information.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 1 -amended
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 3

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found GUILTY - amended Possession of controlled substance
Count 2: Found GUILTY Possession of drug paraphernalia
Count 3: Found GUILTY Possession of drug paraphernalia

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1: - Amended
Jail sentence of 30 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
No electronic monitor until Defendant serves 60 days
2 days sentence credit
Probation for a period of 2 Years
Conditions:
Continue with treatment plan
Maintain absolute sobriety with regard to alcohol and drugs
Pay a fine of $10 plus court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Do not possess drug parahernalia unlawfully
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Fill all controlled substances from a single pharmacy. May obtain specific substance from specific pharmacy if need be
Sign all health releases so agent can monitor treatment and medications
Maintain full time employment
Comply with other counseling as deemed appropriate the agent

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 30 Days, Consecutive to Count 1, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
No electronic monitor until Defendant serves 60 days
Probation for a period of 2 Years, Concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $10 plus court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1

Count 3:
Jail sentence of 30 Days, Consecutive to Count 1 and Count 2, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
No electronic monitor until Defendant serves 60 days
Probation for a period of 2 Years, Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $10 plus court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 Count 2

State will file Information later. No objections.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued

Defendant Jason M. Knapp in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Jason M. Knapp in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will adjourn for 2 weeks to all the defendant to see the Public Defender. Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jason M. Knapp
Current: 3311 Patti Drive Apt #7, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 11-23-2015)
Prior: 137 Tommys Tpke, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Heroin, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  
State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11/23/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
